introduction_scene.title: Introduction
introduction_scene.read_aloud: Hi everyone. I’m going to be running you through a quick demo on how to play D&D. I’m the Dungeon Master, so it’s my job to tell you what’s happening in the world around you and rolling any dice for the monster. You’re playing the heroes!
introduction_scene.gm_guidance: Introduce yourself and welcome the players. Explain your role as the Dungeon Master.

stormy_seas.title: Stormy Seas
stormy_seas.read_aloud: Your journey has been smooth sailing so far. You left the bustling port of Neverwinter a few days ago, heading for an island with the foreboding name of Stormwreck Isle. But you woke this morning to a blood-red sunrise, and dark clouds overhead threaten a violent storm.
stormy_seas.gm_guidance: Set the scene with a blood-red sunrise and impending storm. Show the players the illustration of their ship at sea.

merrow_encounter.title: Merrow Encounter
merrow_encounter.read_aloud: As lightning flashes across the sky, a monster hauls itself up onto the deck! 'These waters belong to the Scaled Queen. I’m here to collect her tribute.'
merrow_encounter.gm_guidance: The merrow demands tribute of 400 gp. Players can negotiate using Charisma checks (DC 15) to reduce the amount by 100 gp per success. If players ask about the Scaled Queen, describe her as a huge, two-headed merrow blessed by Demogorgon. If players attack, the merrow fights back but is not a major threat.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The merrow can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The merrow makes two Rend attacks.

actions.name: Rend
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage.

storm_calm.title: Calm After the Storm
storm_calm.read_aloud: With a splash, the merrow disappears into the ocean deeps and the ship continues on its way. The sailors raise a cheer, and the storm brewing overhead seems not quite so threatening now.
storm_calm.gm_guidance: Describe the relief of the sailors and the calming of the storm. Transition to the next scene as the ship approaches Stormwreck Isle.

arrival_at_dragons_rest.title: Arrival at Dragon's Rest
arrival_at_dragons_rest.read_aloud: Stormwreck Isle—now visible off the bow—promises rare wonders. Seaweed shimmers in countless brilliant colors below you, and rays of sunlight defy the overcast sky to illuminate the lush grass and dark basalt rock of the island.
arrival_at_dragons_rest.gm_guidance: Describe the approach to Dragon's Rest. Encourage players to introduce their characters and discuss their reasons for visiting. Ask for the party's marching order.

drowned_sailors.title: Drowned Sailors
drowned_sailors.read_aloud: As you’re about to leave the beach and start your climb, you hear a ruckus of splashing and a wet, gurgling moan behind you. Three figures are shambling up from the water’s edge, about thirty feet away.
drowned_sailors.gm_guidance: The players face three zombie sailors. They can choose to fight or flee. If they fight, use initiative to determine order. Zombies have Undead Fortitude, which can be bypassed with radiant damage or critical hits. If players are defeated, Elder Runara rescues them.

stats.name: Zombie
stats.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can’t speak

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.description: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it makes a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.description: The zombie doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Slam
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

dragons_rest_temple.title: Dragon's Rest Temple
dragons_rest_temple.read_aloud: The ship drops anchor at the mouth of the harbor, and two sailors row you ashore. You have plenty of time to admire the towering statue at the center of the temple, depicting a wizened man surrounded by seven songbirds.
dragons_rest_temple.gm_guidance: Describe the temple and the path leading up to it. Encourage players to explore and interact with the environment. They can discuss their reasons for visiting Dragon's Rest.

characters.name: Unknown
equipment: Broken blade as a trophy from a fallen enemy
characters.background_story: You trained as a soldier in the land of Mintearn and joined a mercenary company. You traveled to the city of Neverwinter with your company to serve in both the army and the city watch. Over time, you clashed visibly with many of your fellow soldiers. They seemed to enjoy their authority and subjugate the people they’re supposed to protect. Your background shaped your character as a righteous warrior. You learned several languages in the course of your military career (shown in “Languages” on page 1).
